page.title: 10THE STOOLBALL MATCH
page.content: Stoolball is a traditional Sussex Game rather like cricket but with posts which are squares of wood on top of metal posts. We were going to play a team from a nearby village called Hurst Green. We set up the two posts and waited for the visitors to arrive. The toss decided that our team was to bat first. The bats have short handles and a round head that is flat on one side. Hurst Green had lots of different bowlers and we were all out quite quickly. We scored 21 runs. I caught out one of the boys who had been batting for a long time but in the end they beat us by 8 runs. Three Cheers for Hurst Green, Hip, hip...... Afterwards we went home to have tea.
